name: Shining pepperweed, Peppergrass, Tongue grass
overview: This annual herb has a slender stem, small leaves along the stem, and larger leaves near the base. At the top of the stem, flowers with white spoon-shaped petals protrude. Its fruits range from green to pink shiny color.
habitat: An annual herb native to western America. Found in Nevada, California, and Baja California. It can thrive in a diverse range of habitats but is mostly found in California along the coastline.
tags: spoon shaped petals flower plant red shiny Lepidium nitidum var. nitidum Shining pepperweed plants
